instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message:
When I measure up in diode mode it give me 0.49
when i measure in V mode it give me 12.6 V and then slowly it's dropping. 
What does it means?

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message:
It means it is failing.....lol ;)

What board are you talking about???

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Check R7005, should be 20ohm...... Also remove F7040 and see if voltage gets stable on pin 1....

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: R7005 is 20ohm. removed f7040 measured at pin one i get 12.5V for 3 seconds and it goes down to 5V slowly and then back again to 12.5 and so on

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Resistance between pin 17 and 18 and between pins 27 and 28 from U7000.....

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Voltage on pin 2 from U7000 is stable??

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: 16.52V stable

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: ok, what about the other question, resistane between pins 17/18 and 27/28...

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Seems fine. Look around TPS51125 area, corrosion?

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Don't touch U7000 just yet. If U7000 is dead it should still power on from a battery that has a charge.

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: there's no corrosion around TPS51125

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: i have a green light in the charger and that's it. any thoughts on this?

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: No, connect a battery that holds a charge and see if it will power on.

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Put back F7040 first of course....

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: i did connect a battery and still nothing...the F7040 is on the board

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Check resistance to GND on L7220 and check voltage on R7273. Do this without battery and on AC, see if it pulses.

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message:
R7273 is 3.4V
L7220 1.71kohm

I was keep tracking where on the board it starts the voltage to drop and i find out on Q7085 at pin
1 i have 16.26V
2 is 16.26V
3 is 16.26
4 is 15.5 13.3 and 5.5V 
5 is 16V then 15 14 13V its dropping to 4 ad so on like PPBUS_G3H

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Is 3V coming high on L7220 for a moment? I'm suspecting the 51125

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: 0V on the L7220

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: Replace the 51125

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: replaced same problem ppbus_g3h it's stable for 2 seconds and then it's dropping slowly

threads.title: Ppbus_g3h
threads.message: U7000 is next then.
